meanings.definition: To prevent or defend against something.
meanings.sent1: She was forefending the house from intruders.
meanings.sent2: The knight was forefending the kingdom from the dragon.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was forefending its acorns from the mischievous chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: The mother forefended her child from the dangers of the playground.
meanings.sent5: The security guard forefended the museum artifacts with utmost care.

meanings.definition: The act of protecting or guarding against something.
meanings.sent1: Forefending is crucial in keeping our community safe.
meanings.sent2: The forefending of the castle was entrusted to the brave soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The forefending of the cookies from the cookie jar was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The forefending of the secret was like holding a precious gem.
meanings.sent5: The forefending of the treasure map led to an exciting adventure.
